OG.content: for Rousseau, danger of image, imaginary seduction, in writing & masturbation, “fatal advantage (funeste avantage)” > the supplement that “trompe (cheats) la nature”

Rousseau contra Hobbes: pity/compassion is a natural law (beasts have it too), mother’s law, law of the (soft) voice, pity “takes the place of” instituted law, supplements law [though it works the other way around too]; mother’s law, written in our hearts by God > natural writing, writing of heart—not reason, before reason: writing (of reason) is w/out pity, transgresses law of voice, a perverse passion
for Rousseau, first there is self-love (l’amour de soi) [not unnatural l’amour-propre], and then love of the (m)other > pity is a suppléant, which can be supplanted by law/society
pity protects man, vir, homo against love of woman, against the becoming (child becoming-man, mother becoming-woman) that is the great substitution > pity saves virility
for Rousseau, amorous passion perversion of natural pity—limits our attachment to a single person
jealousy, a creation of culture, an arresting of nature by woman, stratagem of femininity > invention of culture denatures pity [which should reach out to every living thing]
jealousy marks the gap btwn pity/love
acc. Rousseau, “moral love” not biology but power of imagination > all depravity of culture related to possession of women (movement of preference/difference)
imagination (perfectibility), for Rousseau, is more proper to man than reason > pity is born of imagination
imagination inaugurates perfectibility & liberty [whereas animal sensibility is passive, fixed] > activates pity
imagination belongs to same chain of signification as anticipation of death, is le rapport à la mort > both imagination & death are representative and supplementary (dispossession)
system of terror (fear of death) & pity (power of identification), tragic scene of representation, imagination, death
pity is innate (man & animal), imagination is the becoming-human of pity
virtuality (innateness) of pity—imagination (which activates reserve of pity) perverts itself, is subject of perversion > imagination awakens pity & transgresses it
nature as limit concept—impossible equilibrium btwn reserve & desire, imagination breaks equilibrium, desire must leave its reserve; acc. Rousseau, ethics: to come closest to this limit
Rousseau: nearer we are to jouissance, further from bonheur ——imagination is differance of or w/in presence or jouissance
imagination alone has power of giving birth to itself, creates nothing: but receives nothing alien or interior to itself [khōra?] > other name of differance as pure auto-affection
human pity, imagine suffering of other as such, imagine passage from suffering to death: one & same limit/opening > relation w/ death & other: otherwise mute, solitude, animal
unlike Hobbes, for Rousseau, fearfulness of other, weakness, causes ferocity/cruelty, can’t declare war > slumbering pity [pre-society] neither incites justness nor malice
Rousseau’s neutral origin of ethico-political conceptuality [is this so different than Hobbes? i.e. no injustice w/out law]
via Rousseau’s pity, ours is the others, identification as non-identification
Rousseau’s pity as distance, not “do onto others…” but “do good to yourself w/ as little evil as possible to others” > don’t interiorize other’s pain too much (it would no longer be the other’s)
imagination as memory as time as pity > opens reign of law & concept: concept is Dasein [Hegel], exists as time
music born of voice (not sound), thus from imagination–pity
acc. Rousseau, imitation & pity have same foundation: sort of metaphorical ecstasy > Rousseau: imitation rooted in perpetual desire to transport ourselves beyond ourselves
[review of Rousseau] voice immediacy, hieroglyphic immediacy, in and out of nature: [double bind of] need & passion, Rousseau describes une différance supplémentaire [writing/pity]
[vis-à-vis Rousseau] absolute fear as original encounter w/ other as other, 1st passion, la face d’erreur de la pitié
for Rousseau, imagination irritates/ravages desire, representation (North, winter, death) as danger of supplement—whose efficiency is of the imagination
